content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Below is an example implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    wrapped_text = join([words[1]])
    current_line_length = length(words[1])

    for i in 2:length(words)
        word = words[i]
        if current_line_length + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            wrapped_text *= " " * word
            current_line_length += length(word) + 1
        else
            wrapped_text *= "\n" * word
            current_line_length = length(word)
        end
    end
    
    return wrapped_text
end
```

Here's an example of how you can use the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Integer pretium massa a accumsan. "
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text, 20)
println(wrapped_text)
```

Output:
```
Lorem ipsum dolor
sit amet,
consectetur
adipiscing elit.
Integer pretium
massa a accumsan.
```
